question.title: No implementation found for boolean android.util.Log.isLoggable after JNI_CreateJavaVM
question.body:
I'm try to exec Log.isLoggable after JNI_CreateJavaVM. Got the error as below with Android 14 and above.

01-02 11:35:15.704 24244 24244 F zygote64: runtime.cc:707] Pending exception java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: No implementation found for boolean android.util.Log.isLoggable(java.lang.String, int) (tried Java_android_util_Log_isLoggable and Java_android_util_Log_isLoggable__Ljava_lang_String_2I) - is the library loaded, e.g. System.loadLibrary?
01-02 11:35:15.704 24244 24244 F zygote64: runtime.cc:707]   at boolean android.util.Log.isLoggable(java.lang.String, int) (Log.java:-2)

There is no issue with Andoird 13, 12.

I noticed that jniRegisterNativeMethods was called after my codes. And try to implement boolean android.util.Log.isLoggable(java.lang.String, int).

// mylog.c
JNIEXPORT static jboolean Java_android_util_Log_isLoggable(JNIEnv* env, jobject clazz, jstring tag, jint level) {
    jboolean false;
    return false;
}

Then load library with System.loadLibrary("mylog"); but still got Pending exception java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: No implementation found for boolean android.util.Log.isLoggable(java.lang.String, int) (tried Java_android_util_Log_isLoggable and Java_android_util_Log_isLoggable__Ljava_lang_String_2I) - is the library loaded, e.g. System.loadLibrary?

question_comments.body: ... why are you calling JNI_CreateJavaVM yourself, on Android? Also, this looks like the same situation as the same question you asked a year ago You got the advice to look at the full call stack, which you did not include in this post. Voting to close as "needs debugging information" although "not reproducible" applies too.

I try to load android_runtime with System.load("/system/lib64/libandroid_runtime.so") and add it to /system/etc//system/etc/public.libraries.txt. Still return "No implementation found for boolean android.util.Log.isLoggable"
